title: An Azure App Configuration Feature Declaration

id.title: Feature ID
id.description: An ID used to uniquely identify and reference the feature.

description.title: Feature Description
examples: This will display a fancy background on the home page.

display_name.title: Feature Display Name
display_name.description: A display name for the feature to use for display rather than the ID.

enabled.title: Enabled State
enabled.description: A feature is OFF if enabled is false. If enabled is true, then the feature is ON if there are no conditions (null or empty) or if all conditions are satisfied.

conditions.title: Feature Enablement Conditions
conditions.description: The declaration of conditions used to dynamically enable features.

requirement_type.title: Requirement Type
requirement_type.description: Determines whether any or all registered feature filters must be enabled for the feature to be considered enabled.

client_filters.title: Client Filter Collection
client_filters.description: Filters that must run on the client and be evaluated as true for the feature to be considered enabled.

name.title: Client Filter Name
name.description: The name used to refer to and require a client filter.

parameters.title: Client Filter Parameters
parameters.description: Custom parameters for a given client filter. A client filter can require any set of parameters of any type.
